attacks.name: Phoenix Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Blaine's Moltres and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

abilities.name: Bench Guard
abilities.text: As long as Brock's Rhydon is Benched, whenever 1 of your Benched Pokémon is damaged, you may do 10 of that damage to Brock's Rhydon instead. (If more than 1 of your Benched Pokémon is damaged at the same time, you may use this power once for each of them.)

attacks.name: Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may return any number of your Pokémon in play and all cards attached to them to your hand.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Away
attacks.text: Shuffle Erika's Dragonair and all cards attached to it into your deck. Then, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

abilities.name: Pollen Defense
abilities.text: If an attack does damage to Erika's Vileplume while it's your Active Pokémon (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power works even while Erika's Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: If Erika's Vileplume does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove a number of damage counters from Erika's Vileplume equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Erika's Vileplume has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Repeating Drill
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Energy Charge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Lt. Surge's Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to Lt. Surge's Magneton. This power can't be used if Lt. Surge's Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Magneton does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Knockout Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 60 more damage. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does 30 damage.

abilities.name: Flee
abilities.text: If an attack does damage to Misty's Tentacruel while it's your Active Pokémon, you may switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, which prevents all other effects of that attack on Misty's Tentacruel. This power can't be used if Misty's Tentacruel is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Crosscounter
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Rocket's Hitmonchan attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for double that amount of damage. (If Rocket's Hitmonchan takes 20 damage, it does 40 damage to that Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.text: When Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out, you may return it to your hand after discarding it. This power can't be used if Rocket's Moltres is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Fire Wall
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Moltres during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out), Rocket's Moltres attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for 10 damage. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Shadow Images
attacks.text: Whenever Rocket's Scyther is attacked, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does no damage to Rocket's Scyther. (Any other effects of the attack still happen.) This effect lasts until Rocket's Scyther takes damage (or is Benched or is evolved).

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon has already has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Call of the Night
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

name: Brock
rules: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Erika
rules: Each player may draw up to 3 cards. You draw first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Lt. Surge
rules: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Misty
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: The Rocket's Trap
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose up to 3 cards at random from your opponent's hand (don't look at them). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 3 of them. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 2 of them. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Onix can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Horn Toss
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Brock's Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Needles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sandstorm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Alert
attacks.text: Draw a card. Then, switch Brock's Zubat with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. You can't use this attack if your Bench is empty.

attacks.name: Moonwatching
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Erika's Victreebel is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu in order to use this attack.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: You may reduce all damage done by attacks to Misty's Cloyster by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Any other effects of attacks still happen). This power can't be used if Misty's Cloyster is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Water Ring
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon that isn't Water on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mysterious Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Pod
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Pokémon named Tentacool, Tentacruel, Misty's Tentacool, and/or Misty's Tentacruel. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Restless Sleep
abilities.text: If your opponent's attack does damage to Rocket's Snorlax and Rocket's Snorlax is already Asleep (even if it's Knocked Out), this power does 20 damage to the attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Rocket's Snorlax is now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Sonic Distortion
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Child's Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If there are fewer than 5 cards in your deck, discard all of them.) This attack does 20 damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Lucky Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiral Dive
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Toss
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Strange Barrier
abilities.text: Whenever an attack by a Basic Pokémon (including your own) does 20 or more damage to Erika's Dratini (after applying Weakness and Resistance), reduce that damage to 10. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Erika's Dratini is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Erika's Exeggcute takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

attacks.name: Egg Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing to the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Exeggcute does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Erika's Gloom. If Erika's Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Magic Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Vile Smell
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

abilities.name: Photosynthesis
abilities.text: All Energy cards attached to Erika's Oddish provide Grass Energy instead of their usual type. This power works even while Erika's Oddish is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flytrap
attacks.text: Before doing damage, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Removal Pulse
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Confusion Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Misty's Poliwhirl. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon with Misty in its name and put it onto your Bench. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Misty's Starmie but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Crystal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Night Spirits
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Sabrina's Gastlys, Sabrina's Haunters, and Sabrina's Gengars you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Good Night
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Good Morning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon was Asleep, it is no longer Asleep.

attacks.name: Naptime
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Sabrina's Slowbro and Sabrina's Slowbro is now Asleep. If Sabrina's Slowbro has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Screaming Headbutt
attacks.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmander in order to use this attack. If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Blaze
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Grass Pokémon on your opponent's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Blaine's Ponyta.

attacks.name: Full Speed Charge
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads to the Defending Pokémon and 20 damage times the number of tails to Blaine's Tauros.

abilities.name: Natural Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from Blaine's Vulpix. This power can't be used if Blaine's Vulpix is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Fan
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card with Brock in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Hook Shot
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fidget
attacks.text: Shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bellow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Drill Tackle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Brock's Sandshrew during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Vine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Erika's Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Erika's Exeggcute. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: If there are any damage counters on Erika's Oddish, remove 1 of them.

attacks.name: Sporadic Sponging
attacks.text: If Erika's Oddish has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 of those damage counters.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to Lt. Surge's Pikachu.

attacks.name: Lightning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Rattata's Gnaw attack's base damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Spin Ball
attacks.text: Flip 1 coin. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Stare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return a Psychic Energy card attached to Sabrina's Abra to your hand in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Suggestion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spook
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sleight of Hand
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 cards from your hand and put them on top of your deck. Then search your deck for that many basic Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lazy Attack
attacks.text: Sabrina's Slowpoke is now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Poison Antennae
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

name: Blaine's Quiz #1
rules: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Brock
rules: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Charity
rules: Attach Charity to your Active Pokémon. Unless that Pokémon gets Knocked Out, return Charity to your hand at the end of your turn. If that Pokémon attacks and does damage to the Defending Pokémon, you may reduce that damage by any amount (rounded to the nearest 10).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Erika
rules: Each player may draw up to 3 cards. You draw first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Lt. Surge
rules: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Misty
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: No Removal Gym
rules: A player must discard 2 cards from his or her hand in order to play an Energy Removal or Super Energy Removal card.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: The Rocket's Training Gym
rules: Each player pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Blaine's Last Resort
rules: You can't play this card if you have any cards in your hand other than Blaine's Last Resort. Show your hand to your opponent, then draw 5 cards.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Brock's Training Method
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card with Brock in its name. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Celadon City Gym
rules: During each player's turn, that player may choose to discard an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Erika in its name. If that player does so, that Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Cerulean City Gym
rules: Each player pays Colorless less to retreat his or her Pokémon if it has Misty in its name.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Erika's Maids
rules: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards with Erika in their names from your deck. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Erika's Perfume
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Basic Pokémon cards there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Good Manners
rules: In order to play this card, you can't have any Basic Pokémon cards in your hand. Show your hand to your opponent, then search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Lt. Surge's Treaty
rules: Your opponent chooses 1 of the following: everyone chooses 1 of his or her own Prizes and put it into his or her hand, or you draw a card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Minion of Team Rocket
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and return it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. If 1 or both of them are tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Misty's Wrath
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 2 of those cards and put them into your hand. Discard the rest.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Pewter City Gym
rules: Don't apply Resistance to any attacks made by Pokémon with Brock in their names.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Recall
rules: For your attack this turn, your Active Pokémon can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Sabrina's ESP
rules: Attach Sabrina's ESP to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name. At the end of your turn, discard Sabrina's ESP. If that Pokémon uses and attack that involves flipping coins, Sabrina's ESP lets you re-flip those coins once. If you do, re-flip all the coins.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Secret Mission
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. Then, you may discard as many other cards as you want from your hand and draw that many cards.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Tickling Machine
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent sets aside all the cards in his or her hand face down. Nobody may look at those cards. At the end of your opponent's next turn, your opponent puts those cards back into his or her hand. If tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Vermilion City Gym
rules: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Blaine's Gamble
rules: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Energy Flow
rules: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Misty's Duel
rules: You and your opponent play a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The winner shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of 5 cards. (If you don't know how to play Rock-Paper-Scissors, flip a coin to decide who's the winner.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Narrow Gym
rules: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Sabrina's Gaze
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of the same number of cards.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Trash Exchange
rules: Count the number of cards in your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck. Then discard that many cards from the top of your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
